ErrorDocumentNotReady.message: Document not loaded completely. Please wait for a while and try again.

ExtensionDescription.description: Description of the extension as it's visible to the outside world
ExtensionDescription.message: Captures the web page faithfully with highly customizable configurations.

ExtensionName.description: Name of the extension as it's visible to the outside world

IndexerDesc.message: Pick directories or ZIP archive files of a Web ScrapBook folder, via dropping them into this window, or using the buttons below:

IndexerPickDirTooltip.message: When selecting a folder in this way, the root directory cannot be correctly identified if the root directory contains only a single folder. Select a folder via dropping, or add a file or a folder containing files to the root directory, to avoid this issue.

OptionCaptureCanvasBlankTooltip.message: Save the initial blank canvas. This is recommended if scripts are saved.

OptionCaptureCanvasSaveTooltip.message: Generate a initialization script that records the current canvas status and draw it when the saved web page is loaded. NOTE: This could introduce a conflict if scripts are saved.

OptionCaptureCanvasTooltip.message: Canvases are blank initially and drawn by web page scripts. "Save current status" can be used when scripts are not saved, and "Save initial status" is more recommended when scripts are saved.

OptionCaptureCommonBlankTooltip.message: Keep the element but disable its link or content.

OptionCaptureCommonLinkTooltip.message: Rewrite the referenced link to its source. Note that this will trigger a network flow when browsing the captured document in the future.

OptionCaptureCommonSaveCurrentTooltip.message: Save only the currently referenced resource to local. This reduces size but could break cross-platform compatibility and could cause a missing of required files if scripts are saved.

OptionCaptureCommonSaveTooltip.message: Save the referenced resource to local.

OptionCaptureCommonRemoveTooltip.message: Remove the element. Note that this could affect the web page layout.

OptionCaptureScrapbookFolderTooltip.message: Captured files will be saved in <download folder>/<Scrapbook Folder>/data/ directory when "Save captured data in ScrapBook" is checked. You can create a symbolic link targeting a desired directory if necessary.

OptionCaptureFontSaveUsedTooltip.message:
Save only the fonts that is applied to the current web page. This reduces size but could cause a missing of required files if scripts are saved.

* Due to the security restriction of same origin policy, this feature works only for stylesheets from the same domain currently.

OptionCaptureImageBackgroundSaveUsedTool.message:
Save only the background images that is applied to the current web page. This reduces size but could cause a missing of required files if scripts are saved.

* Due to the security restriction of same origin policy, this feature works only for stylesheets from the same domain currently.

OptionCaptureRecordRewrittenAttrTooltip.message: If an attribute is rewritten during the capture process, create a corresponding data-* attribute to record its original value.

OptionCaptureRecordErrorUriTooltip.message: If connection to a URL failed during the capture process, record it as urn:scrapbook:*. If unchecked, link to the source address (which could still be unavailable and be an invalid connection).

OptionCaptureRecordRemovedNodeTooltip.message: If an element is removed during the capture process, create an HTML comment in place to record its original content.

OptionCaptureRecordSourceUriTooltip.message: If a URL is rewritten during the capture process, create a data-* attribute or HTML comment to record its original address.

OptionCaptureSaveAsciiFilenameTooltip.message: The captured file will have non-ASCII chars in the filename encoded.

OptionCaptureSaveAsFolderTooltip.message: Generate a folder and save the web page and resource files into it. (For Chrome, it's recommended that "Ask where to save each file before downloading" be unchecked to avoid tons of prompts.)

OptionCaptureSaveAsTooltip.message: HTZ and MAFF files can be viewed via "View archived page" or via unzipping it.

OptionCaptureSaveAsMaffTooltip.message: Web pages and their referenced resources are packed into a MAFF file using ZIP algorithm.

OptionCaptureSaveAsSingleHtmlJsTooltip.message: Referenced resources are stored in the script and re-generated on loading. This has a better performance and a reduced size compared with data URL, but requires a modern browser with JavaScript enabled, such as: Chrome ≥ 20, Firefox ≥ 13, Edge, Safari ≥ 6, Opera ≥ 12.1, and IE ≥ 10. NOTE: This could introduce a conflict if scripts are saved.

OptionCaptureSaveAsSingleHtmlTooltip.message: Referenced resources are stored as data URL, which is supported by most browsers, such as Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari, Opera ≥ 7.2, and IE ≥ 8 (very limited in IE). NOTE: For some web pages, data URL can cause a severe drop of performance and bloat of file size.

OptionCaptureSaveAsZipTooltip.message: Web page and its referenced resources are packed into an HTZ file using ZIP algorithm.

OptionCaptureSaveDataUriAsFileTooltip.message: A filename will be auto-generated according to the MIME type and the SHA-1 hash of the content of the data URL.

OptionCaptureSaveFileAsHtmlTooltip.message: Save a browser-viewable non-HTML file as an HTML web page.

OptionCaptureSaveInScrapbookTooltip.message: Captured files will be saved in <download folder>/<Scrapbook Folder>/data/ directory. Files are always saved in ScrapBook when saved as folder.

OptionCaptureScriptLikeTooltip.message: Such saved objects may not work correctly in the offline context or in the viewer, and have a potential security risk.

OptionCaptureScriptTooltip.message: This determines how to handle all page scripts, including SCRIPT elements, links with javascript: protocol, and dynamic attributes such as onclick, etc. NOTE: Saved scripts may not work correctly in the offline context or in the viewer, and have a potential security risk.

OptionIndexerAutoDownloadTooltip.message: The input folder must be configured ScrapBook Folder, or the files could be incorrectly overwritten.

OptionViewerAllowScriptsLabel.message: Allow execution of scripts and embedded objects:

OptionViewerAllowScriptsTooltip.message: When checked, scripts and embedded objects will be run in a special privileged environment, such that they may not work correctly, and can allow malicious codes to be executed without protection. It is generally not recommended to view such archive page using the viewer.

OptionViewerUseFileSystemApiTooltip.message: Use filesystem API to create a virtual filesystem and view the archive file when supported, to get a better performance and fidelity.

OptionViewerViewHtzTooltip.message: When the browser loads an HTZ file, view it with the viewer. Check "Allow access to file URLs" in a supported browser to enable opening such files directly.

OptionViewerViewMaffTooltip.message: When the browser loads a MAFF file, view it with the viewer. Check "Allow access to file URLs" in a supported browser to enable opening such files directly.

ViewerDesc.message: Pick an HTZ or MAFF archive file to open, via dropping it into this window, or using the buttons below:

WarnCaptureCyclicRefercing.message: Resource '$SOURCE$' has a circular reference to '$TARGET$', which will be blanked because current capture configuration does not support circular reference.
